member.name: M:Couchbase.BucketConfigListener.Start
member.summary: Starts listening for configuration data. This method blocks until the initial configuration is received. (Or until all pool urls fail.)

member.name: M:Couchbase.BucketConfigListener.ReleaseListener(Couchbase.MessageStreamListener)
member.summary: Unsubscibes from a pooled listener, and destrpys it if no additionals subscribers are present.

member.name: M:Couchbase.BucketConfigListener.GetPooledListener
member.summary:
Returns a MessageStreamListener instance based on this instance's configuratino (timeout, bucket name etc.)
When multiple listeners are requested with the exact same parameters (usually when multiple clients are instantiated from the same configuration), the same listener will be returned each time.

member.name: P:Couchbase.BucketConfigListener.DeadTimeout
member.summary: Time to wait in milliseconds to reconnect to the pool when all nodes are down.

member.summary: Raised when the pool's configuration changes.

member.name: M:Couchbase.Configuration.ICouchbaseClientConfiguration.CreateDesignDocumentNameTransformer
member.summary: Creates a name transformer instance whihc will be used to change the design document's name before retrieving it from the server.
member.remarks: This way you can create additional views over the same data, and use one set production and other set(s) for testing and development without changing your application code. (Couchbase provides UI support 'development views' where the name of the design document is prefixed with dev_.)
member.returns: A transformed name.

member.returns: A that contains the items that occur after the specified index in the view.

member.summary: Couchbase will not update the view before returning the data even if it contains stale values. Use this mode if you favor improved query latency over data constistency.
member.returns: A new instance that includes the stale items from the view.

member.name: M:Couchbase.CouchbaseClient.GetView``1(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an object representing the specified view in the specified design document.
member.param: The name of the design document.
The name of the view.

When true, the client will return an instance of T by deserializing the document that is retrieved using the row's id. When false (use when emitting projections), the client simply attempts to deserialize the view's value into an instance of T by matching properties.

member.name: T:Couchbase.VBucketAwareOperationFactory
